definition[0]: broken pieces of wood and other things from a wrecked ship, floating in the sea or scattered on the shore
example[0]: He would walk along the beach collecting the flotsam and jetsam that had been washed ashore.
definition[1]: things that people no longer want and so throw away
example[1]: works of art made from the flotsam and jetsam of everyday life
definition[2]: people who are very poor and do not have jobs or homes
example[2]: Camps were set up to shelter the flotsam and jetsam of the war.
